name: Fake Sourdough Biscuits
author: Marie
summary: These are referred to as fake sourdough biscuits, but are really refrigerator rolls. Very easy to make, and so handy.
ingredients: ¾ cup warm water (110 degrees F/45 degrees C)
directions: Allow to stand until mixture is frothy
In a large bowl, whisk together flour, sugar, salt, baking powder, and soda
Add shortening and work until crumbly
Mix in yeast mixture and buttermilk
Store, well covered, in a greased bowl in the refrigerator
Don't worry if it is a little sticky; it will firm up as it chills
Dough can be stored up to 2 weeks
When ready to make rolls, take out amount needed
Turn dough out on a lightly floured surface, and knead for 2 or 3 minutes
Bake in a preheated 400 degrees F (205 degrees C) oven for 15 minutes, or until golden brown
